docs.abstract: The Communist Party wants to instill the people with “core socialist values.” That means winnowing out content that extols individualism or hedonism.
docs.snippet: The Communist Party wants to instill the people with “core socialist values.” That means winnowing out content that extols individualism or hedonism.
docs.lead_paragraph: China is waging a war on fun. The latest target: men’s earrings.

headline.main: No Earrings, Tattoos or Cleavage: Inside China’s War on Fun
headline.print_headline: China’s Fun Is Sanitized With a Blur

docs.abstract: Apple’s slumping iPhone sales in China are the latest sign that the country’s spenders are increasingly bothered by the economy, debt and other problems.
docs.snippet: Apple’s slumping iPhone sales in China are the latest sign that the country’s spenders are increasingly bothered by the economy, debt and other problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — For years, no matter what was happening elsewhere, global companies bet billions upon billions of dollars that China’s consumers would keep spending money.

headline.main: Chinese Consumers’ Confidence Sags, Casting a Pall Over the Global Economy
headline.print_headline: China’s Woes Spell Trouble In the Global Marketplace

byline.original: By Alexandra Stevenson, Li Yuan and Raymond Zhong

docs.abstract: The cloud computing project, known as JEDI, is one of the largest federal information technology contracts in history.
docs.snippet: The cloud computing project, known as JEDI, is one of the largest federal information technology contracts in history.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Pentagon said Wednesday that Amazon and Microsoft were the final candidates for a hotly contested $10 billion contract to bring modern cloud computing to the Defense Department.

headline.main: Amazon and Microsoft Are 2 Finalists for $10 Billion Pentagon Contract
headline.print_headline: Amazon or Microsoft Will Deliver the Pentagon to the Cloud

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: Here's what you need to know about talc and the health-related claims surrounding it.
docs.snippet: Here's what you need to know about talc and the health-related claims surrounding it.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 12,000 women have sued Johnson & Johnson, with most claiming the talc in its well-known product Johnson’s Baby Powder caused their ovarian cancer. They now have a new potential legal front.

headline.main: What Is Talc, Where Is It Used and Why Is Asbestos a Concern?

docs.abstract: A Tokyo judge set bail at 1 billion yen after rejecting prosecutors’ arguments that he should not be freed.
docs.snippet: A Tokyo judge set bail at 1 billion yen after rejecting prosecutors’ arguments that he should not be freed.
docs.lead_paragraph: Carlos Ghosn, the high-profile auto executive whose legal travails have riveted Japan and global investors, is poised to leave jail after a court granted his latest request for bail.

headline.main: Carlos Ghosn, Former Nissan Chairman, Nears Release From Jail
headline.print_headline: Disgraced Ex-Nissan Chairman Nears Release From Jail

docs.abstract: Mark Karpelès, who ran the exchange that helped make the cryptocurrency a household name, was found guilty of falsifying data by a Japanese court.
docs.snippet: Mark Karpelès, who ran the exchange that helped make the cryptocurrency a household name, was found guilty of falsifying data by a Japanese court.
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — A Tokyo court handed down a two-and-a-half-year prison sentence on Friday to the former head of Mt. Gox, a cryptocurrency exchange that helped establish Bitcoin as a household name before spectacularly imploding amid allegations of mismanagement.

headline.main: Bitcoin Tycoon Who Oversaw Mt. Gox Implosion Gets Suspended Sentence
headline.print_headline: Bitcoin Tycoon Held in Japan Has Sentence Suspended

docs.abstract: A lawyer for the former auto executive takes the blame for disguising Carlos Ghosn as a construction worker when he was released on bail after 108 days
docs.snippet: A lawyer for the former auto executive takes the blame for disguising Carlos Ghosn as a construction worker when he was released on bail after 108 days
docs.lead_paragraph: A lawyer for Carlos Ghosn issued an apology Friday to try to calm a media storm over a disguise worn by the former car executive as he left jail.

headline.main: Amid Media Storm, Carlos Ghosn’s Lawyer Apologizes for Disguise
headline.print_headline: Apology Issued After Ghosn Wears Disguise

docs.abstract: Mr. Ghosn, the former head of the Nissan-Mitsubishi-Renault alliance charged in Tokyo with financial wrongdoing, posted $4.7 million bail.
docs.snippet: Mr. Ghosn, the former head of the Nissan-Mitsubishi-Renault alliance charged in Tokyo with financial wrongdoing, posted $4.7 million bail.
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Carlos Ghosn, the former automotive executive charged with financial wrongdoing, was released from a Tokyo jail on Thursday evening after posting a multimillion-dollar bond for the second time in two months.

headline.main: Carlos Ghosn, for a 2nd Time, Is Released From Jail After Posting Bail
headline.print_headline: For a 2nd Time, Ghosn Posts a 7-Figure Bail and Is Released

docs.abstract: The vast carmaking alliance must still grapple with difficult issues, such as resolving tensions between the Japanese and French partners.
docs.snippet: The vast carmaking alliance must still grapple with difficult issues, such as resolving tensions between the Japanese and French partners.
docs.lead_paragraph: YOKOHAMA, Japan — Nissan and Renault vowed on Tuesday to preserve their carmaking alliance and overhaul how it works, as the Japanese and French automakers seek to move past the removal of their former top executive, Carlos Ghosn.

headline.main: Nissan and Renault Overhaul Alliance as They Look Past Carlos Ghosn
headline.print_headline: Carmakers Retool Alliance After Ghosn’s Exit

docs.abstract: With their former leader in jail, the automakers must figure out how to overcome a fierce corporate pride and work together.
docs.snippet: With their former leader in jail, the automakers must figure out how to overcome a fierce corporate pride and work together.
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — It was a simple plan. Renault and Nissan, two partners in a vast auto-making alliance, would pool their resources to build a new low-cost car in, and for, emerging markets.

headline.main: Nissan and Renault Are Rid of Carlos Ghosn. Now, Can They Save Their Partnership?

byline.original: By Ben Dooley and Liz Alderman
